subdisciplines.name: Building Systems Engineering
subdisciplines.description: The study and application of engineering principles to building systems, including HVAC, lighting, electrical, plumbing, and fire protection systems.

subdisciplines.name: Construction Management
subdisciplines.description: The planning, coordination, and control of a construction project from inception to completion to meet a client's requirements in order to produce a functionally and financially viable project.

subdisciplines.name: Structural Engineering
subdisciplines.description: The analysis and design of structures capable of resisting loads to ensure the safety, reliability, and durability of a building.

subdisciplines.name: Environmental Control Systems
subdisciplines.description: The integration of mechanical and electrical systems to control the indoor environment, including temperature, humidity, air quality, and noise, for the comfort of occupants and to conserve energy.

subdisciplines.name: Acoustical Engineering
subdisciplines.description: The science of sound and its behavior in a space, and the design of building structures and materials to optimize sound quality.

subdisciplines.name: Sustainable Design
subdisciplines.description: The practice of designing buildings to optimize their energy and resource efficiency, reduce their impact on the environment, and improve the health and comfort of their occupants.

subdisciplines.name: Building Energy Modeling
subdisciplines.description: The practice of simulating the energy use of a building using computer software in order to optimize its energy performance.
